pull.title: wallet: Fix migration of blank wallets
pull.body:
Blank wallets (wallets without any keys are scripts) are being detected as already being descriptor wallets even though they are not. This is because the check for whether a wallet is already a descriptor wallet uses the presence of a `LegacyScriptPubKeyMan` which is only setup when keys or scripts are found. This PR resolves this issue by checking for the descriptor wallet flag instead and subsequently skipping the keys and scripts part of migration for blank wallets.

Fixes the issue mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28868#issuecomment-1809641110

events.message:
wallet: Skip key and script migration for blank wallets

Blank wallets don't have any keys or scripts to migrate

wallet: Check for descriptors flag before migration

Previously we would check that there is no LegacySPKM in order to
determine whether a wallet is already a descriptor wallet and doesn't
need to be migrated. However blank legacy wallets will also not have a
LegacySPKM, so we need to be checking for the descriptors flag instead.
wallet: Better error message when missing LegacySPKM during migration
tests: Test migration of blank wallets

rename.to: wallet: Fix migration of blank wallets

issue.title: wallet: Fix migration of wallets with txs that have both spendable and watchonly outputs
issue.body:
A transaction does not necessarily have to belong to either the migrated wallet (with the private keys) and the watchonly wallet (with watchonly things), it could have multiple outputs with each isminetype. So we should be putting such transactions in one or the other wallet, but rather putting it in both.

I've added a test for this behavior, however the test also revealed a few other issues. Notably, it revealed that `migratewallet` would have the watchonly wallet rescan from genesis when it is reloaded at the end of migration. This could be a cause for migration appearing to be very slow. This is resolved by first writing best block records to the watchonly and solvable wallets, as well as updating the test to make sure that rescans don't happen.

The change to avoid rescans also found an issue where some of our early exits would result in unloading the wallet even though nothing happened. So there is also a commit to reload the wallet for such early exits.

events.body:
> For backport or no?

No, I don't think this is a regression, nor is it really a bug that is that important. If someone runs into it, the wallet is completely blank and empty, so they can just delete it and make a new descriptors wallet.

issue.title: wallet: Migrate entire address book entries to watchonly and solvables too
issue.body: Not all of the data in an address book entry was being copied to the watchonly and solvables wallets. This includes information such as whether the address was previously spent, and any receive requests that may exist. A test has been added to check that the previously spent information is copied, although it passes without the changes in this PR since this information is also regenerated when a transaction is loaded/added into a wallet.

issue.title: wallet: Migrate legacy wallets to descriptor wallets without requiring BDB
issue.body:
Currently migrating to descriptor wallets requires having BDB available. In order to remove BDB from the project, we need to be able to do these migrations without BDB. This PR adds `BerkeleyRODatabase` which is an independent implementation of a BDB file parser. It can be used to read uncorrupted BDB files and extract all of their records. This is used for both the wallettool's `dump` command, and `migratewallet`.

Based on #26606

events.body:
Concept ACK

Evaluating descriptor wallets using descriptor wallet flag instead of the presence of  LegacyScriptPubKeyMan when migrating wallets

comments.body:
If this truly should never happen, and it seems like an internal bug when it happens, then I wonder if the translation is needed and if `STR_INTERNAL_BUG` can be used?

```suggestion
        error = Untranslated(STR_INTERNAL_BUG("Error: Legacy wallet data missing"));
```
